outline.ch:
*本課程為大一英文系學生設計。非該設定範圍的學生計劃選修本課程，請於第一週的課程說明會結束後與授課老師聯繫。少量的密碼卡將根據屆時的人數來決定發放。
Starting as a debate in the field of Philosophy on the interplay between human emotions and cognition, the topic of emotions/affect started to receive much attention among critics across disciplines on the eve of the Millennium. With the increase of interdisciplinary conversations at the beginning of the 21st century—including neuroscience, cognitive psychology, political science, history, literature, etc.—scholars have declared that we are now in the era of emotions. This course offers a platform for students to familiarize with this trend by introducing the concept of “emotional literacy” (how do we ‘read’ emotions) and its complicated, at times problematic, integrations with popular culture. Our course seeks to answer the following core questions: what is the nature of emotion? what is the role it plays in contemporary popular culture, particularly at the juncture of the making of public opinions and censorship? Class content will consist of regular short lectures, presentations, movie screening, and group discussions based on the weekly assigned texts (which include articles and films). The course will be conducted entirely in English and no pre-requisites needed.

textbook.ch: There will be NO physical course reader. All of our course readings (primary and secondary) will be provided by the instructor after the first day of class via google document (in pdf files). Students can determine if they want to have the plays printed out; however, whatever they choose, students MUST bring the text to class every single week: either you carry the print-out, or you bring the laptop/ electronic reader (your phone NOT included). No text, no attendance.
